text: Hi everyone - I was wondering if there is a nice way to show code snippets in the text editor. We have a client who just migrated on HubSpot and had a lot of code snippets in their blogs (it was using a WP plugin) so I am looking for a way to show these into HubSpot. Thank you!
w

<@U7X5W7GAK>
really depends how the code snippets were implemented on the wordpress site, one way you could do it is before importing the blog find and replace say a wordpress shortcode that wraps the code with a div with a class. Then use a javascript library to make the code syntax highlighted and whatnot.  Another way is to use the |replace() filter on the blog content but that’s prone to more problems than going in and replacing the shortcodes.

If the code is not placed in the blog posts content but instead in some kind of widget area or part of the template, you could export that data and when importing it import it into a rich text field and have that rich text field be inside of a div with a class, then target that div with javascript and use whatever highlighting tool you want.

Another option if the code is all html, css, and JS, then I’d honestly recommend using codepen and embedding the code that way. It will make it more future proof and gives viewers more ability to play around and better understand the code. Paying for codepen pro(which is pretty cheap) allows further visual customization so the embed can look however they want to fit their site.
Hi <@U7SL518D6> - thank you very much! That's very explanatory, I'll check how this was implemented on WordPress to find out more - Thanks again

Hell everyone, classic question

 I need to get this JSON in a custom module or in a template on HubSpot
<https://www.ariase.com/getHeaderFooter>

Is there any solution to get this ? (because when i'm using $.getJSON( "<https://www.ariase.com/getHeaderFooter>", function( data ) {}): I have a CORS error
Thanks all
Does it change much?
yes that's why my client give to me a JSON to only maintain a file
what are best practices for "staging" a significant blog revision considering there is no staging tool
as the  main website is (unfortunately) not in HubSpot
collect your thoughts.  i am going to eat lunch :)
Would json p work here
I will truy
I just use the preview tool since it loads in the current posts in the default blog. I wish there were a way to stage a blog template and select a blog to use it with.
try adding a call back to the end of the url
like ?
$.getJSON( "<https://www.ariase.com/getHeaderFooter?callback=?>", function( data ) {}):

<@UD53A9UUR> use the preview tool to the extent you can - if your blog is going to involve special fields then you’ll want to create a new dummy blog to test with so you can add info to fields not currently available in the posts.
sorry miss type $.getJSON( "<https://www.ariase.com/getHeaderFooter?callback=?>", function( data ) {console.table(data)});
i guiess that didnt work either. herm..
snifff
what i was attempting: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/5943630/basic-example-of-using-ajax-with-jsonp>
Yeah. Just checking. I create a sandboxed blog to develop on and then once approved switch templates on live blog. Just thought I would ask the smart people if they had a better way
i just realized what he gave you isnt a json file
it is html with json in a pre tag
you're right !
As i'm using HubSpot Dev extension it convert correctly the file so i didn't notice
I will talk to my client !
thanks <@U38EZFVFE>
:slightly_smiling_face:
_pushes :eyeglasses: up on nose_
looks like you are smart too Dennis

Hey guys, I'm fairly new to HubSpot so looking for help. All my CTAs have a HubSpot link like the following:
*<https://cta-service-cms2.HubSpot.com/ctas/v2/public/cs/c/?cta_guid=c956354d-69d3-4f34-bf8......*>
Although it's link to a page within the HubSpot with dedicated URL e.g. */services*. Is there a way so it displays the URL it's linked to? Thanks a lot.
Wondering how an event calendar may be developed in HubSpot — anyone have any examples of this?
many ways, easiest/most flexible is HubDB with a javascript calendar library like calendar.js
I contacted HubSpot support about it and they said it was a feature to help with formatting. I have only seen it in one portal. :man-shrugging:
Unfortunately, I dont think there is a way to do this. This url is needed to be hit in order for the click to be registered for stats.
another best practice question.

how do you keep HubSpot from getting confusing when you have blogs, hubdb, webpages, and landing pages to update.  Have a client who is getting frustrated because events and team members are in hubdb.  have various blogs and need to update pages.  sometimes the events are pulled into a page so they get confused thinking they can edit at the page
trying to figure out a way to make it as efficient as possible for them, but what i think is efficient sometimes does not align with what they think
if that makes sense
going to lunch so collect your thoughts :)

Best thing to do is sit down with them and give them full on training, you used the right tools for the respective jobs. You didn’t build the UI they interact with the data with, you’re just trying to provide the best editing experience you can. with the tools you have.

yeah.  I imagine a lot of it also has to do with scope creep.  suddenly we also need this to have this additional functionality.  I admit that the event hubdb setup i made became less than ideal, but i already built it out. then had to build a garage on it and then another porch on that..
c'est la vie

yea, I hate it when things get like that. especially if you make something really complicated with HubDB then the client wants something that requires like a structural change in how you handle the data
suddenly you have a kitchen sink in the bedroom and a toilet in the dining room
sadly, it gave a lot of my non dev team a bad taste for hubdb.
ps:  this developer menu is changing my life.
coded templateers - *Can you set a coded template as a 404 error page?* not seeing my coded template show in the system pages settings
You have to manually change the template type through the API. I requested the ability to do this through the UI a while ago
O_O any chance it can be done via FTP like how the meta info for custom modules is done? If not it’s fine I’ll use the API
Not familiar with how the meta info with FTP works but API it pretty easy
Not possible via FTP but if you create the file in the IDE as a specific type of template first that should work
yea it didn’t give me that prompt for some reason when making a coded file
I may or may not have been completely blind, that was there and I ignored it :faceplam:

We just made our very first HubSpot site live this week. What are some of the best practices for implementing and modifying features post-launch? Obviously our goal would be to keep the live site stable and get on some sort of release cycle rather than have every change to the code immediately live like we've been doing in pre-launch dev.
you can use content staging
:thumbsup: to content staging, either that or the “grip it and rip it” method
lol grip and rip it? do tell

Thanks so much! Would this help us with changes to existing custom modules? Or at least the testing of new ones? A cursory search gave me the impression this would be more geared toward content creation than development.

<https://image.spreadshirtmedia.com/image-server/v1/mp/products/T812A2MPA1663PT17X0Y45D1006322435S71/views/1,width=500,height=500,appearanceId=2,backgroundColor=F2F2F2,modelId=115,crop=list,version=1542188494/i-push-directly-to-prod-men-s-premium-t-shirt.jpg>

you can use it for both.. I mean if you’re just going to change existing modules, just build the modules in a way that you can easily add things without negatively impacting existing pages using the module
I definitely think we can make that work. Thanks for the feedback! It's much appreciated.
So the idea is that you develop it perfectly on the first try then just send it.
yea…. about that…
I’m not a web developer, I’m a web producer
and I’m spiderman the original web developer
ha
we need a dumpster fire emoji
with great power comes great responsibility
i make a WIP and PROD folder for my modules and templates
clone prod modules to wip and do your damage.  once damage is done, copy to prod module unless it would affect the copy in the module on a page.
ability to create folders was huge for me
Like I mentioned - this is on our radar and we're actively exploring how to solve it in the future.
in enrollment triggers for workflows is the "is unknown" value basically just meaning if the field is blank? (this is also something i think needs to be documented better)
Interesting.

Yeah, I use it primarily to do QA on stylesheet updates and minor changes to the HTML/HubL. If it's a huge change to the codebase then it might not be feasible.

It's really more of a workaround than a smart solution anyway. The current sandboxing features (content staging) are too limited for our needs and also quite cumbersome to work with, in my opinion.
<@U38EZFVFE> is the developer version of Sherlock Holmes :slightly_smiling_face: :raised_hands:
the HubDB docs + Calendar.js will prob help get you there: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/how-to-build-dynamic-pages-with-hubdb>
<@UAJ6S71L6> check out <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/website-user-guide/how-to-redesign-and-relaunch-your-site-with-content-staging>
:sleuth_or_spy:
